derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from medieval Latin carui, from Arabic alkarāwiyā, probably from Greek karon 'cumin'

entry.tran: 葛缕子(其籽常用作调味料)
entry.def: Caraway is a plant with strong-tasting seeds that are used in cooking. Caraway seeds are often used to flavour bread and cakes.

means.word_mean: 1. a Eurasian plant with small white flowers yielding caraway seed
2. leaves used sparingly in soups and stews
